titleStmt.title: Charles J. Vander Espt to Daniel C. Wickliffe
CWG7885

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
No 4
Louisville Ky, Feby, 10th 1863.
To Hon Secretary of State
Frankfort, Kentucky,"
Sir,

Permit me to call your attention as to my Commission as notary public in the County of Jefferson, whether the same, is to be renewed, for which I respectfully solicit your answer. The last, received from ex-Governor Magoffin, reads thus: "by & with the advise & consent of the Senate."
If necessary, I would be very thankful to receive your advise on the subject, I remain,

Very Respectfully your obdt Servant,
Chas J Vander Espt,
"acting vice-Consul of Belgium"
To Hon. -- Secretary of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, -- Frankfort,
